{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3568138,"name":null,"username":"Doubledogdare","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/c89c15/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T16:36:50.926Z","cooked":"

I want to program a vibration in our controllers when endgame initiates, because last year our drivers had a hard time paying attention to the time or game sounds. Is there a way to get the game time in our code, or at least a way to get it from elastic?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T16:36:50.926Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":168.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3568142,"name":"Jimmy McCosker","username":"Jimmyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T16:39:22.605Z","cooked":"

Call DriverStation.getMatchTime() and use logic if the match time is more or less than x amount of seconds

you actually can get a lot of useful things from your DS, look at the documentation

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T16:41:13.459Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":436,"readers_count":435,"score":202.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Jimmy McCosker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/DriverStation.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"DriverStation (WPILib API 2025.3.2)","clicks":44}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/2","custom_user_title":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568143,"name":"Ben Kallhoff","username":"99099","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/99099/{size}/250305_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T16:39:26.816Z","cooked":"

Bit of a scuffed solution but you could start a timer in RobotInit, then rumble when it’s endgame time

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T16:39:26.816Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":432,"readers_count":431,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Ben Kallhoff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69031,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I’m here I guess"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/3","custom_user_title":"I’m here I guess","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568148,"name":"George Perez","username":"wpi_jorge","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wpi_jorge/{size}/208628_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T16:48:00.082Z","cooked":"

Realistically this is an issue that should be solved by coaching, however in your RobotInit you can call your in game match time using the driver station.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T16:48:31.228Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":382,"readers_count":381,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"George Perez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Driver / Programmer / Strategist"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/4","custom_user_title":"Driver / Programmer / Strategist","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568518,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T22:17:49.197Z","cooked":"

I’m pretty sure robotInit runs when you first turn on the rio, so this would lead to inaccurate timing. This could work with a timer starting at teleopInit, though.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T22:18:07.807Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":279,"readers_count":278,"score":115.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Pedro Braga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69031,"username":"99099","name":"Ben Kallhoff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/99099/{size}/250305_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568561,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T23:17:19.104Z","cooked":"

Note that this is not an official match timer and you cannot argue with the ref over timing on the basis of “the API said it was such and such time remaining.”

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T23:17:19.104Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":250,"readers_count":249,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52943,"username":"Jimmyy","name":"Jimmy McCosker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/6","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568566,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T23:21:38.190Z","cooked":"

Ive been curious what the deal is with it being an “unofficial” match time.

Are we talking clock drift? Network latency? Or just a catch-all, “this method provides no guarantees” but 99.9% of the time it’ll be accurate within 20ms.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T23:21:38.190Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":55.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Eric Ward","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3637 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/7","custom_user_title":"3637 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568571,"name":"David Racovan","username":"superpenguin612","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a3d4f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T23:26:42.057Z","cooked":"

For one, the returned value only changes in full integer increments when the FMS is connected (unlike when in practice mode on a DS), and the FMS does not expose the exact match time to robots.

github.wpilib.org

DriverStation (WPILib API 2025.3.2)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj, class: DriverStation

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-25T23:26:42.057Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":108.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"David Racovan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/DriverStation.html#getMatchTime()","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"DriverStation (WPILib API 2025.3.2)","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":35208,"username":"bathtubed","name":"Eric Ward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RustHOUNDS Ri3D | 868 Strategy/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/8","custom_user_title":"RustHOUNDS Ri3D | 868 Strategy/Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568612,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T00:26:47.716Z","cooked":"

Hmm… do we know if it rounds up or down? Since it’s impossible to check without being in a match…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T00:26:47.716Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Eric Ward","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55388,"username":"superpenguin612","name":"David Racovan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3637 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/9","custom_user_title":"3637 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568615,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T00:30:18.907Z","cooked":"
bathtubed:

just a catch-all, “this method provides no guarantees”

i think its this, in a sense that you cant use the time returned here to argue for any ref/scoring things (which idek how you would but). in the sense that youre only supposed to use this method to replace having a human look at the sign or screen above

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T00:30:18.907Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/10","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568628,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T00:42:46.343Z","cooked":"

The other reason it provides no guarantees is that there have been years in which the endgame timing mattered a lot, e.g. 2011 mini-bot races, and we didn’t want teams assuming this method could be used to trigger those types of actions.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T00:42:46.343Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57670,"username":"nevadexehs","name":"neev dadhania","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/11","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568681,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T01:21:08.887Z","cooked":"
nevadexehs:

which idek how you would but

It’s not hard to imagine a team sending someone to the question box arguing that their robot couldn’t have illegally extended prior to the designated endgame period, because the command to trigger the extension is keyed off of the timer provided “by FIRST” in the library.

We’d like to discourage anyone from doing this. If relying on the WPILib match timer leads to your robot getting a foul, you’re not getting a field fault and a replay.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T01:21:40.216Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":41.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/12","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568738,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T02:01:48.937Z","cooked":"
Peter_Johnson:

there have been years in which the endgame timing mattered a lot

Is there any known/sure-fire way to do this properly?

I might imagine a timer from the beginning of TeleopInit would be reliable within 50ms?

My team had a situation where we noticed an issue with FMS disabling our robot before match time was supposed to strike zero. We had already won the match, but it was frustrating that we lost our climb (and therefore RP) on it.

In a legalistic sense? No.

In a practical sense? Use the timer with a safety margin as a “backup trigger” and don’t worry too much about it.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T02:15:58.245Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":36.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496871,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":35208,"username":"bathtubed","name":"Eric Ward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-way-to-program-the-game-time-into-a-robot/496871/15","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3568749,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T02:19:30.417Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

In a practical sense? Use the timer with a safety margin as a “backup trigger” and don’t worry too much about it.

effectively this, or bake in some margin of error. eg. 20 seconds to climb, start climb command at 22 seconds remaining according to the function.

or the simple thing of rumbling/flashing when an important time comes and let a human make the decision
